forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of drizzle. Partly cloudy, with a low around 56. West southwest wind around 9 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

forecast.name: Monday
forecast.shortForecast: Slight Chance Drizzle then Mostly Sunny
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of drizzle before 11am. Mostly sunny. High near 65, with temperatures falling to around 63 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 8 to 20 mph, with gusts as high as 23 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

weather_report:
As dawn begins to break in Downtown San Francisco, a gentle chill lingers in the air, hinting at the embrace of marine layers that have crept closer to the shore. The night may have brought with it a whisper of drizzle, which now dissipates into the backdrop of a sky that is only beginning to clear. Today promises glimpses of that famed sun which has eluded the city for much of the early morning. Highs will hover around the mid-60s—a comfortable warmth offered by the sun, though clouds will still linger in playful opposition.

The breeze from the west southwest carries with it a freshness, dancing through the streets with gusts that could lift spirits and skirts alike. Yet, it’s wise to layer up in anticipation of the fluctuating temperatures; a light jacket will serve perfectly as the warmth of midday beckons. As the city stirs to life, the opportunity arises for leisurely strolls along the waterfront, perhaps a quiet moment in the shade of a tree in one of the parks, or indulging in the rich flavors at a local café where the atmosphere is as inviting as the coffee itself. The day lays before you, filled with the promise of exploration and the simple pleasure of being amidst the city’s enduring charm.
